item.description:
A few of us from South Shore and others from C.H.A.O.S. meetup climbed at Rumney this past weekend. It was great and we're going to go again this Sunday so if you couldn't make it last week...
Rumney has great sport climbing where it's easy to set up top ropes too. If you have a rope please say so and bring it. We need ropes! Also, bring lead/trad gear if you want to do that.

Here is a good site for info on climbing at Rumney: http://mountainproject.com/v/rumney/105867829

Let's meet in the large Rumney parking lot, at the picnic tables, near the info board where you pay for parking ($3), at 9am. Please be punctual. Rumney is a two hour drive from Boston so please plan your departure accordingly. I anticipate being out until about 4-5pm, but this is flexible depending on weather and fun level. 

It's pretty easy to find if you've never been. Head up 93 and take exit 26 for NH-25/3A towards Rumney. Merge onto NH-3AS/Tenney Mtn Hwy and go about 4 miles to a large traffic circle, stay right and take the first exit onto NH-25W. After about 3.5 miles turn right onto Main st. Go about 0.7 miles and turn left onto Buffalo Rd by a white church. Rumney parking lot will be on the right about a mile down Buffalo Rd. Copy and paste this into google maps: 43.801905,-71.830019

Please post in your rsvp if you will be bringing a rope and/or other gear (quickdraws, anchor building gear, etc.).

No dogs, no babies. Crags are not a good place for either of these creatures.

Required gear: Harness, belay device, climbing shoes, something to eat, water. ROPE if you have it please!

Helmets are a good idea too. You are responsible for your own safety.

Also, there is a decent outhouse at the parking lot. Relax.
item.name: Climbing Rumney
